reviews.review_msg: One of the best instructors I've had in my entire undergrad.  A great storyteller that deviates from the typical PowerPoint pedagogy and a great sense of humour to boot.  The course material is applicable to so many other disciplines as the key ideas are centred around oppression and inequality.  His choice in films was very interesting.

I always looked forward to Simon's class. Great lecturer. I liked the class activities, such as the class play, role-playing, field trip etc. I just wished he balanced his material a little more - it seemed to be geared towards one end of the political spectrum.

Simon is a brilliant instructor with a vast range of expertise across many disciplines. He introduces topics in an intriguing way, analysing them through several perspectives, so students can see their similarities and contradictions. Simon challenges popular ways of thinking, provides strong evidence in doing so, and cares about students greatly.
